meanings.definition: To make someone extremely angry or irritated.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise maddened the dog.
meanings.sent2: She was maddened by his constant interruptions.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock maddened the locksmith.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam maddened the commuters.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive music maddened her to the point of tears.

meanings.definition: To become extremely angry or irritated.
meanings.sent1: He maddened quickly when his computer froze.
meanings.sent2: As the delays continued, passengers maddened in the airport.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel maddened the gardener by stealing all the nuts.
meanings.sent4: The unanswered phone calls maddened her like a buzzing fly.
meanings.sent5: The unresolved issue maddened him more and more each day.
